title: 103_hr862
content: The Act titled "Long-Term Care Insurance for the Elderly Act of 1993" allows tax-free distributions from individual retirement accounts for individuals aged 59 1/2 or older to purchase long-term care insurance coverage. Subsection (d) of section 408 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to allow tax-free distributions from individual retirement accounts for individuals aged 59 1/2 or older to purchase long-term care insurance coverage. Tax-free distributions from individual retirement accounts can be used within 90 days to purchase long-term care insurance for the individual or their spouse. The applicable percentage depends on the taxpayer's adjusted gross income. The applicable percentage for tax-free distributions from individual retirement accounts to purchase long-term care insurance depends on the taxpayer's adjusted gross income. The percentage is calculated based on the difference between the maximum and minimum amounts. The text chunk discusses services provided for catastrophic and long-term care at a nursing facility or at the beneficiary's home, including homemaker/home health aide services, personal care, and nursing care. The term "minimum amount" is defined as $45,000 for any taxable year, adjusted for the cost-of-living. The term 'maximum amount' for a taxable year is $100,000, adjusted for the cost-of-living. Amounts are rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. If the amount is not a multiple of $10, it shall be increased to the next multiple of $10. SEC. 3. REPORT TO CONGRESS ON MINIMUM STANDARDS FOR LONG-TERM CARE INSURANCE POLICIES. Within a year of this Act's enactment, the Secretary of Health and Human Services will submit a report to Congress proposing minimum standards for long-term care insurance policies. The report will involve consultation with various stakeholders, including consumer groups, insurance companies, long-term care facilities, hospitals, home health care agencies, and state commissioners of insurance. The analysis will focus on different catastrophic and long-term care insurance policies available to individuals. The Secretary of Health and Human Services may determine additional areas of examination for long-term care insurance policies. The amendment made by section 2 will apply to payments or distributions after the first day of the first calendar year following the enactment of this Act.
